result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott K Meherg Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If unpaid a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Payment plan to begin on 2-1-2021 in the amount of $100/month.
Credit for time served.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

10:44 AM Defendant Scott K Meherg in court with attorney Alexander J. Kostal.  Lucas P. Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.  Plea was contingent on payment of restitution.  Defense indicates that most of the restitution was paid and once the $500 bond is applied the rest will be paid.  State does not object and is prepared for sentencing today. Plea to the charge without the repeater, State recommends credit for time served.  Court performs colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  CC used as a factual basis.  Parties waive PSI.   Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf.
